description: Server for the prediction of allosteric and regulatory sites on protein structures. It queries protein dynamics and structural conservation to identify pockets that may exert a regulatory effect upon binding of a small-molecule ligand.
name: PARS

metadata.abstract: Summary: The regulation of protein activity is a key aspect of life at the molecular level. Unveiling its details is thus crucial to understanding signalling and metabolic pathways. The most common and powerful mechanism of protein-function regulation is allostery, which has been increasingly calling the attention of medicinal chemists due to its potential for the discovery of novel therapeutics. In this context, PARS is a simple and fast method that queries protein dynamics and structural conservation to identify pockets on a protein structure that may exert a regulatory effect on the binding of a small-molecule ligand. © The Author 2013. Published by Oxford University Press.
metadata.title: PARS: A web server for the prediction of Protein Allosteric and Regulatory Sites
